p: We used general fungal primers that do not specifically target mycorrhizal fungi, and consequently, the observed shifts in the drought treatments will mainly reflect differences in the abundances of decomposer and pathogenic fungi (Klamer & Hedlund, 2004; Sayer et al., 2013). Nonetheless, a previous study at Buxton showed that the drought treatments reduced the density of extraradical mycorrhizal hyphae in the soil (Staddon et al., 2003), which could also contribute to the shifts in fungal community structure in our study.
